page.title: 02Where We Live
page.content: When the town of Coalville grew up around two coal mines,the area to the NE remained as farmland with just a few large houses.The ground in this area is granite and there are no coal seams.Because of mining subsidence in the town people began building on the granite.Houses have been built here by the Council,the East Midlands Housing Association and by private builders. There are a few small shops here,but mostly people do their shopping in Coalville.The service industries are also in the town.There are plenty of leisure activities in the area.The three Churches have clubs for all age groups;there are Scout and Guide groups,two Youth Clubs and King Edward VII Community College which has a swimming pool,playing fields and evening classes for the local people.
